content:
We're transforming the grocery industry
At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.
Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.
Instacart is a Flex First team 
There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.Overview
We are looking for an experienced systems engineer with a passion for identity management and a deep understanding of zero trust architecture to join our security team. You will work at the intersection of systems engineering, security engineering, and infrastructure engineering to ensure Instacart’s employees have access to the systems and applications they need, when they need it. 
Our goal is to run the world's most trusted and secure grocery technology platform. The IAM function within the Instacart security team works with stakeholders in IT, security, and infrastructure, to ensure swift and secure access to our set of tools, data, and the cloud environments our platform is built upon..About the Team
The security team at Instacart is responsible for ensuring the security and privacy of Instacart’s suite of products and the company as a whole. We believe that with the right mixture of tools and engineering prowess, we can secure our most important assets without negatively impacting employee or partner productivity.
In this role, you will continue to build out our next-generation access management controls, ensuring they’re both user-friendly and firmly secure. You’ll be one of the subject-matter experts in the areas of just-in-time access, infrastructure access, and IAM best practices. This position offers a unique chance for someone eager to take ownership, embrace challenges, and foster both technical and interpersonal skills in a fast-paced environment.
About the Job 
You will continue our zero trust journey by identifying, implementing, and maintaining best-in-class open-source and commercially-available solutions across our applications and infrastructure.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including infrastructure, security platform engineering, and IT to integrate zero trust tools and principles.
Engage in hands-on problem solving, crafting solutions that scale with our growing ecosystem of apps and infrastructure.
Participate in on-call rotations, ensuring our zero trust systems operate flawlessly and are ready to support our employees during critical situations, such as incidents.
Evaluate and leverage state-of-the-art tools and technologies that enhance Instacart’s access management story.
Share knowledge and mentor other team members, promoting a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
About
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
7+ years of experience in the Information Security field, with strong focus on modern identity management concepts like just–in-time access provisioning, zero-trust access to production infrastructure, and cloud-native IAM challenges.
Strong foundation in cloud technologies, with practical experience in securing cloud environments (especially in AWS).
Experience developing simple tools and automation scripts using common DevOps toolsets (e.g. git) and programming languages, such as Python, Ruby, or Go.
Extensive knowledge of access management and IAM principals, technologies, and best practices. You have opinions about what works well and what doesn’t, and you’re eager to share them.
Hands–on experience with corporate zero trust, access management, and infrastructure access tooling such as Opal, ConductorOne, Okta Identity Governance, Okta Advanced Server Access, Teleport, Twingate, or Tailscale.
Excellent communication skills, emphasizing the ability to clearly summarize complex security topics and serve as a strong advocate for the zero trust model and well-architected IAM implementations.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent work experience.
Some experience building or managing services responsible for authentication and authorization.
Strong experience working with AWS or GCP, both as an end-user and in an administrative or security oversight capacity.
Some experience in the realms of container security and container access control.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) technologies, especially Terraform.
Some experience developing web applications with Ruby a plus.

At Instacart, we like to think of ourselves as a potluck—where everyone brings something new, different, and flavorful to the table. We believe our team’s wide range of perspectives, experiences and backgrounds enable us to build a better product for our customers. Instacart is for everyone, and we’re committed to fostering diverse and inclusive teams that reflect the communities we serve.

Individuals seeking employment at Instacart are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic. 

Please note: If you apply for more than one job, you will be asked to fill out the questionnaire for each application.  

Why are we asking?

In order to track our effectiveness in recruiting a wide range of talent, we invite all applicants to self-identify demographic information. Completion of the form is required as part of our standard application process - but disclosing your demographic information is optional. Any information that you do provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file.

Self-identification categories

  • Gender Identity: How a person identifies their gender, regardless of their gender assigned at birth.  
  • LGBT2QIA+: An umbrella term for a range of sexual orientations and gender identities/expressions. Stands for “Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Two-Spirit, Queer, Intersex, and Asexual. The plus sign is meant to encompass all other identities that belong to this community.” 
  • Race/Ethnicity: A person’s racial, ethnic or origin identity.  
  • Disability Status: A person’s physical or mental impairment which may limit one or more of their major life activities. Learn more here.  
  • Military Service: A person who has spent time serving in any branch of the military (retired or active). Learn more here.
